item.title: WoW Looks To Be Getting A New Premium Currency For Housing
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

World of Warcraft may soon receive a new form of premium currency called Hearthsteel, one that will likely be used to buy housing-specific items.

A datamine by Wowhead of the alpha build for WoW's upcoming Midnight expansion revealed the currency and a number of icons that show increasingly larger amounts of it, reminiscent of the icons used to denote premium currency bundles. The currencies are linked to a description that states they are part of a housing market bundle.

While Blizzard has not yet released official details about how Hearthsteel will work or what it will be used for, it's likely it will be similar to that of Trader's Tender, another premium currency used for the game's Trading Post vendor. Trader's Tender is primarily earned in-game by completing monthly challenges. The currency can't be bought on its own in the in-game shop but is included as part of other shop cosmetic bundles. It's also given out as a reward for preordering various editions of WoW's next expansion as well, with more expensive versions of the expansion granting more of the currency.

Hearthsteel might be used similarly in that it's something players may be able to earn by playing but also acquire by buying certain cosmetics on the store. Blizzard has already confirmed it will be selling housing related cosmetics via the shop, so Hearthsteel could potentially be included as part of those bundles for use at a specific housing-item vendor, similar to the Trading Post.

Until Blizzard officially outlines its plans, players will be left to speculate wildly about another form of microtransaction coming to the MMORPG, something one would think Blizzard would like to explain and justify sooner rather than later.

Assuming Hearthsteel will be coming alongside housing early access as part of WoW's 11.2.7 patch, players might not have wait long to learn more. The patch is expected to arrive in December. Midnight does not yet have an official release date but is expected to arrive in February 2026 based on a datamine revealing a date for the expansion's pre-patch.

Midnight's pre-patch will add the entirity of WoW's housing system by introducing Neighborhood events. For those wanting to get a head start on decorating their Azerothian dream home, a new WoW add-on shows all of the housing items tied to existing in-game achievements that can be earned right now.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Neopets: Mega Mini Games Collection Brings 27 Neopets Browser Games To Console
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Remember the good old days when Flash games were at their peak, and it seemed like we had an unlimited free gaming library to choose from, no matter the type of PC you had? While that gilded era is now behind us, the upcoming Neopets: Mega Mini Games Collection will soon let us revisit some of the most memorable Neopets browser games when it launches for Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, and PC on March 26, 2026. The game will feature 25 classic Neopets flash games, plus an all-new minigame exclusive to this collection made by the original Neopets team, and a secret unlockable bonus minigame, for a total of 27 minigames. Each classic minigame has been enhanced for modern platforms with higher-resolution graphics and new features like local co-op modes. Preorders are available now for just $30, and securing an early copy gets you some cool physical extras and bonus DLC.

Neopets: Mega Mini Games Collection Preorder Bonus

The physical PS5 or Nintendo Switch versions of Neopets: Mega Mini Games Collection come with an exclusive set of extra items, including a double-sided poster, two sticker sheets, three art cards, and DLC for the Neopets website. While not strictly preorder bonuses, preordering your copy is a wise decision if you want these extras, as they may sell out soon after launch. Note that these bonus items are only included in the physical edition of the game. There are no preorder bonuses included in the digital edition.

Neopets: Mega Mini Games Collection

$30 | Releases March 26, 2026

Neopets: Mega Mini Games Collection includes the base game on your platform of choice, plus the extra items listed above if you grab the physical edition. As mentioned above, this collection features 27 minigames--but instead of just being a smattering of games, the collection features a story mode that will let you explore a map of Neopia as you unlock and complete each activity. Local co-op play is enabled for select games in the collection, including Snowball Fight, Jumpinâ€™ Gem Heist, Jubble Bubble, and more, which means you can bring a friend along for part of your journey. The game also syncs with Neopass so you can unlock cosmetics, currency, and other rewards for the official Neopets website.

Physical PS5 and Nintendo Switch editions are available for preorder at Amazon. Digital preorders are also available.

While Neopets: Mega Mini Games Collection isn't getting a dedicated Switch 2 release, it will be playable on Nintendo's new console thanks to backward compatibility. If you're looking for more upcoming games to play on Switch 2, be sure to check out some of the many other Switch 2 games available to preorder.

Switch 2 Game Preorders

  • Assassin's Creed Shadows -- $60 | Releases December 2
  • Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero -- $60 | Releases November 14
  • Dragon Quest VII Reimagined -- $60 | Releases February 5, 2026
  • Final Fantasy VII: Remake - Intergrade -- $50 | Releases January 22, 2026
  • Hades II -- $50 | Releases November 20
  • Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment -- $70 | Releases November 6
  • Kirby Air Riders -- $70 | Releases November 20
  • Mario Tennis Fever -- $70 | Releases February 12, 2026
  • Metroid Prime 4: Beyond -- $70 | Releases December 4
  • Octopath Traveler 0 -- $50 | Releases December 4
  • Reanimal -- $40 | Release TBA
  • Resident Evil Requiem -- $70 | Releases February 27, 2026
  • SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide -- $40 | Releases November 18
